abstracts.cdata!:
One of the main components of the Third
            Highway Project is the Kuitun-Sailimu Hu Highway, an
            important section of the National Trunk Highway System
            (NTHS) and the remaining gap on the 1430 km stretch of the
            National Highway 312 in Xinjiang. It will undergo major
            construction, alignment, and upgrading. During the designing
            period, the design of sewage treatment in stations and
            service areas should guarantee the life sewage and
            industrial wastewater within disposal standard. The highway
            should avoid running through residential districts in
            cities/towns, and the alignment should be away from schools
            and hospitals. The highway should occupy as little
            farmlands, grasslands, and woods as possible. Trees removed
            will be replanted. During construction, sewage from the
            construction camps can be led into available drainage
            network. Wastewater with oil should be collected and stored
            in a pond for eventual drying up. Oil or chemical pollutants
            and waste materials will be disposed of in accordance with
            regulations. Water should be sprayed to avoid dust. The new
            construction and traffic access roads should be paved with
            asphalt. Noise impacts will be reduced by locating
            constructions far away from protected areas. No borrow pits
            are allowed in the wind gap and farmlands. Sites should be
            restored after construction. During operation, enclosing
            walls will be built to reduce noise levels. Live sewage
            water can be used for landscaping purpose following treatment.
